analyzed: chos nyid tshul bzhin du yang yid la bgyi'o //
translated: and should also properly pay attention to the real nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid @138a *//
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid @138a *//
translated: these two are the real nature.

original: de; gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de; gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The real nature of conditioned phenomena and the real nature of unconditioned phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
translated: what is the real nature of conditioned phenomena?

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi ye shes dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi ye shes dang /
translated: the wisdom of inner emptiness, the wisdom of outer emptiness, the wisdom of outer and inner emptiness, up to the wisdom of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the wisdom of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the wisdom of the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation,

original: smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ye shes dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ye shes dang /
translated: the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ye shes dang / zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi ye shes dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ye shes dang / zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi ye shes dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni /
translated: the wisdom of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas, the wisdom of defiled and undefiled dharmas, and the wisdom of mundane and supramundane dharmas,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces @138b bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces @138b bgyi'o //
translated: that is the dharmatƒÅ of conditioned dharmas.

original: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang lags she na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the dharmatƒÅ of unconditioned dharmas?

original: de ni gang la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: de ni gang la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa dang /
translated: It is where there is no arising, no ceasing, no abiding, no change from abiding, no defilement, no purification,

original: 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang / 'grib pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang / 'grib pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: no increase, and no decrease.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That is the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang lags she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang lags she na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of all phenomena?

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: All phenomena are the intrinsic nature of non-entityness.

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o //
translated: This is called the intrinsic nature of unconditioned phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka /üîΩde de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka / de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika,üîΩit is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang /
translated: All the tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas of the past

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, who have passed into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa, having relied on this very perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba de dag kyang /
translated: have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the future, who will pass into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa, having relied on this very perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //üîΩda ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o // da ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa dag na /
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @139a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @139a *//
translated: The tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the present, in countless, immeasurable world systems in the ten directions,üîΩhaving relied on this very perfection of wisdom,

original: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
analyzed: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
translated: All those Blessed Buddhas, those Foe-Destroyers, those Fully Enlightened Ones who are present, who are living, who are teaching the Dharma, they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //üîΩ'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig byung ba dang / ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig byung ba dang / ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba dang /
translated: have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.üîΩAll those Hearers who have appeared in the past among the Tathagatas, those Foe-Destroyers, those Fully Enlightened Ones, all those Hearers who will appear in the future among the Tathagatas, those Foe-Destroyers, those Fully Enlightened Ones,

original: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis kyang /
translated: and all those Hearers who are present now among the Tathagatas, those Foe-Destroyers, those Fully Enlightened Ones,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
translated: ‚ÄúRelying on this perfection of wisdom,

original: 'thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: they have attained, will attain, and do attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med pa dag na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med tshad med pa dag na /
translated: As many solitary buddhas as there have been in the past, as many as there will be in the future, and as many as there are in the present in countless, limitless world systems

original: rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'khod cing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang /üîΩshes rab kyi pha @139b rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te rang byang chub thob bo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'khod cing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang / shes rab kyi pha @139b rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te rang byang chub thob bo //
translated: in the ten directions, they too,

original: 'thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: having relied on this very perfection of wisdom, have attained, will attain, and do attain solitary awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
translated: Thus, in this perfection of wisdom all three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: de dag kyang mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / dmigs pa med pa'i tshul dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / dmigs pa med pa'i tshul dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i tshul dang /
translated: And they are taught by way of the absence of signs, by way of the absence of reference points, by way of non-arising, by way of non-ceasing, by way of the absence of affliction and the absence of purification,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'dor ba med pa'i tshul dang / dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul dang / blang ba med pa dang / spang ba med pa'i tshul gyis bstan te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'dor ba med pa'i tshul dang / dbri ba med pa dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul dang / blang ba med pa dang / spang ba med pa'i tshul gyis bstan te /
translated: by way of the absence of performance, by way of non-clinging, by way of non-abandonment, by way of non-depletion, by way of non-addition, by way of non-taking up, and by way of non-relinquishment.

original: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis bstan gyi /
analyzed: de'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis bstan gyi /
translated: And that is taught by way of the method of worldly conventions,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by way of the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ring du song ba ma yin /
translated: This perfection of wisdom does not go far,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a perfection.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not this shore,

original: pha rol ma yin /üîΩthang ma yin /üîΩthang du 'dug pa ma yin /
analyzed: pha rol ma yin / thang ma yin / thang du 'dug pa ma yin /
translated: it is not the further shore,üîΩit is not a plain,üîΩit is not a plateau,

original: gshong du 'dug pa ma yin /
analyzed: gshong du 'dug pa ma yin /
translated: it is not a valley,

original: mnyam pa ma yin /
analyzed: mnyam pa ma yin /
translated: it is not level,

original: mi mnyam pa ma yin /üîΩmtshan ma ma yin /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ma yin / mtshan ma ma yin /
translated: it is not uneven,üîΩit is not a sign,

original: mtshan ma med pa ma yin /üîΩ'jig rten pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ma yin / 'jig rten pa ma yin /
translated: it is not signless,üîΩit is not mundane,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin /üîΩ'dus byas ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin / 'dus byas ma yin /
translated: it is not supramundane,üîΩit is not compounded,

original: 'dus ma byas ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma yin /
translated: it is not uncompounded,

original: dge ba ma yin /
analyzed: dge ba ma yin /
translated: it is not virtuous,

original: mi dge ba ma yin /
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin /
translated: it is not nonvirtuous,

original: 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa ma yin /
translated: it is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: it is not future,

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
translated: and it is not present.

original: koo shi ka /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @140a *//üîΩpa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @140a *// pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Kau≈õika,üîΩthe perfection of wisdom does not establish the qualities of a buddha,

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin; so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams 'dor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin; so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams 'dor ba ma yin no //
translated: it does not establish the qualities of a worthy one, up to it does not establish the qualities of a pratyekabuddha, and it does not discard the qualities of an ordinary person.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol ba /
translated: ≈öakra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste /
translated: this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa rnams ni /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice this perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa yang 'tshal te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa yang 'tshal te /
translated: they know the minds and activities of all sentient beings,

original: sems can du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: but they do not apprehend sentient beings.

original: sems can du gdags par dmigs pa ma mchis so //üîΩbdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang /
analyzed: sems can du gdags par dmigs pa ma mchis so // bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang /
translated: They do not apprehend the designation of sentient beings.

original: mthong ba por dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: mthong ba por dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend a self, a sentient being, a life-force, a soul, a person, an individual, a human, a human being, one who does, one who feels, one who knows, or one who sees.

original: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: They do not apprehend form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: mig tu dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mig tu dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no reference point in the eye,

original: yid kyi bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so; ;gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: yid kyi bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so; ;gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: up to there is no reference point in the mind; there is no reference point in form,

original: chos kyi bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: chos kyi bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: up to there is no reference point in dharmas;

original: mig gi rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no reference point in eye consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs @140b pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs @140b pa ma mchis so //
translated: up to there is no reference point in mind consciousness;

original: mig gi 'dus te reg par dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg par dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no reference point in eye contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: up to there is no reference point in mind contact;

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba tshor bar dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba tshor bar dmigs pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no reference point in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: up to there is no reference point in the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact;

original: sa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: sa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis /

analyzed: de la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /

original: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /

translated: ‚ÄòFeeling,

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston cing /
translated: ‚ÄòForm is suffering, empty, and without a self,‚Äô and ‚Äòfeeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are suffering, empty, and without a self.‚ÄôüîΩThey teach, ‚ÄòOne who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.‚Äô

original: 'di skad du gang de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes brjod de; su la bstan pa de dag kyang gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes brjod de; su la bstan pa de dag kyang gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those to whom they teach will imagine that ‚Äòform is impermanent.‚Äô

analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar de dag gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar rtog pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro // de ltar de dag gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar rtog pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang /
translated: They will think that form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are suffering, are without self, and are foul.

original: rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar rtog pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar rtog pas /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, they will think that form is impermanent, that form is suffering, that form is without self, and that form is foul. They will think that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are impermanent, that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are suffering, that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are without self, and that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are foul.

analyzed: shes rab kyi @160b pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan la spyod par 'gyur ro //

translated: and that the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of mind, mental phenomena, and mind-consciousness is suffering.üîΩHe teaches that the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of ear, sound, and ear-consciousness is not a self,üîΩthat the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of nose, smell, and nose-consciousness is not a self,üîΩthat the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of tongue, taste, and tongue-consciousness is not a self,üîΩthat the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of body, touch, and body-consciousness is not a self,üîΩand that the feeling that arises from the condition of contact through the union of mind, mental phenomena, and mind-consciousness is not a self.

original: sa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya ba ston /
analyzed: sa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya ba ston /

analyzed: sa'i khams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that the earth element is suffering, is without self, and is unattractive.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang; rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang; rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are impermanent.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are suffering, are without self, and are unattractive.

original: ma rig pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: ma rig pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that ignorance is impermanent.

original: ma rig pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: ma rig pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that ignorance is suffering, is without self, and is unattractive.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang; tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang; tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that volitions, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death are impermanent.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang; reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang; reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
translated: He teaches that volitions, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death are suffering,

original: bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: that they are without self, and that they are unpleasant.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that the perfection of generosity is impermanent.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that the perfection of generosity is suffering, that it is without self, and that it is unpleasant.

original: tshul khrims @162a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims @162a *//
translated: He teaches that the perfection of morality is impermanent.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are impermanent.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
translated: He teaches that the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are suffering,

original: bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: that they are not a self, and that they are unpleasant.

original: nang stong pa nyid mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: He teaches that inner emptiness is impermanent,

original: nang stong pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: that inner emptiness is suffering, that it is not a self, and that it is unpleasant.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston; dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston; dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is impermanent, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is suffering, and up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not a self,

original: mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: not clean,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: up to the applications of mindfulness are impermanent,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /

translated: up to the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are impermanent,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu @162b 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu @162b 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and the noble eightfold path are suffering, are not a self,üîΩand are foul.üîΩThey teach that the powers of the buddhas,üîΩthe strengths of the buddhas,üîΩand the aspects of enlightenment are impermanent,

original: mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: are suffering, are not a self,üîΩand are foul.üîΩThey teach that the powers of the buddhas,üîΩthe strengths of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: and the aspects of enlightenment are impermanent,üîΩare suffering, are not a self,üîΩand are foul.üîΩThey teach that the distinct attributes of a buddha are impermanent,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: are suffering, are not a self,üîΩand are foul.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /
translated: They teach that the distinct attributes of a buddha are impermanent,üîΩare suffering, are not a self,üîΩand are foul.üîΩThey teach that the knowledge of all aspects is impermanent,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston cing /

analyzed: 'di skad du gang de ltar ston pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes rjod de /

analyzed: su la bstan pa de dag kyang gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those to whom it is taught will conceptualize that form is impermanent.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will conceptualize that form is suffering, that it is not a self, and that it is impure.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba
translated: You should rejoice in the roots of virtue of the tathƒÅgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, future, and present, from the time when they first gave rise to the mind of awakening until they attained final nirvƒÅ·πáa in the realm of the dhƒÅtu without remainder.

analyzed: tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta zhig /
translated: Do not view perceptions, volitional factors, or consciousness as impermanent.üîΩIf you ask why,üîΩit is because consciousness is empty of a basic nature.üîΩThe basic nature of consciousness is non-existent.üîΩThat which is non-existent is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIn the perfection of wisdomüîΩconsciousness is not apprehended as either permanent or impermanent.

translated: Since consciousness itself does not exist there,üîΩhow could permanence or impermanence be apprehended?üîΩKau≈õika,üîΩif you ask why,üîΩit is because the perfection of wisdom is not consciousness,üîΩand consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom.
